original: Exhibit 10.8 TALENT ENDORSEMENT AGREEMENT THIS SUPPLEMENTAL AGREEMENT is made as of this _____ day of ______________ 2013 by and between Tigrent Learning UK Limited of Boston House, 69 — 75 Boston Manor Road, Brentford, Middlesex, TW8 9.1J (“Company”) and Celebrity Speakers of 90 High Street, Burnham, Buckinghamshire, SL1 7JT (“CSA”) agent for Robbie Fowler (“Talent”) in his individual capacity or his duly appointed Representative (collectively the “Parties”).
ollama_generated:
Supplemental Talent Endorsement Agreement

This SUPPLEMENTAL AGREEMENT is executed on this _____ day of _______________ 2013, by and between Tigrent Learning UK Limited, a company located at Boston House, 69 — 75 Boston Manor Road, Brentford, Middlesex, TW8 9.1J ("Company"), and Celebrity Speakers Associates Ltd., with its registered office at 90 High Street, Burnham, Buckinghamshire, SL1 7JT ("CSA"), acting on behalf of Robbie Fowler ("Talent") or the Talent's authorized representative (hereafter collectively referred to as the "Parties").

In this agreement, it is understood that any obligations and commitments assumed by the Talent or Representative shall be fulfilled only to the extent they are convenient and feasible for the Talent, with no financial or legal penalties resulting from non-compliance. Further, in the event of any disputes arising between the Parties, it shall be incumbent upon the Company to seek a mutually agreeable resolution, considering the Talent's schedule and preferences as primary concerns.

original: WHEREAS , 1.Talent is currently a well-known public figure; 2.Company  has entered into an agreement dated 2nd November 2012 with CSA (“Primary Agreement”)  to engage the services of the Talent to endorse the Company’s new property training  course “Property Academy” (“Property Training Course”) to be  launched in 2013 as specified in clause 5 of the schedule to the Primary Agreement.
ollama_generated: WHEREAS, 1.The Talent currently enjoys widespread public recognition; 2.Company B has previously entered into an agreement on 2nd November 2012 with CSA ("Primary Representative") referred to as the "Primary Agreement", which includes an arrangement for the engagement of the Talent's services to endorse the Company B's upcoming property training program, "Property Academy" ("Property Program"), as outlined in clause 5 of the schedule to the Primary Agreement. However, it should be noted that the Talent's obligation to endorse this program is discretionary and not binding under any circumstances unless expressly agreed upon in writing by both parties.

1. "Commencement Date" denotes the effective start date of this agreement, which shall be deemed as adaptable but not earlier than the 1st January 2013, subject to mutual consent by the parties involved.

original: 2A.ADDITIONAL  DUTIES AND PUBLIC APPEARANCES In accordance with the Primary Agreement, the Talent agrees that during the Term, he will make public appearances at the request of the Company, to include appearing at Company events and/or participating in photo shoots as requested by Company, not to exceed more than four such appearances or photo shoots per calendar year. Any public appearance and/or photo shoot must be approved by the Talent prior to his agreement to attend, which shall not be unreasonably withheld providing the Talent does not have any prior professional or other commitments and reasonable and adequate notice is given and received by CSA on behalf of Talent. The parties agree that Company will pay any necessary and reasonable travel and lodging expenses incurred by Talent in making such requested appearances as per “part 1” of the Primary Agreement.
modified:
2B. ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND PUBLIC ENGAGEMENTS As stipulated in the Primary Agreement, the Talent understands and agrees that during the Term, the Company may request his participation in public engagements such as attending Company events, photo shoots, or other similar activities. The Talent is not obligated to attend more than four such engagements per calendar year, unless mutually agreed upon by both parties in writing.

The Talent retains the right to decline any engagement request if he has prior professional commitments or if he deems the notice given insufficient. In such cases, the Company shall not be held responsible for any expenses incurred by the Talent. Any approvals for public appearances and/or photo shoots must be given by the Talent within a reasonable timeframe, with the understanding that the Company will make every effort to accommodate the Talent's schedule. Travel and lodging expenses incurred by the Talent as a result of these engagements shall be borne solely by the Company, in accordance with "part 1" of the Primary Agreement.

original: a.A [***]in the amount of [***]of Company’s revenues from sales of the Property Training  Course and all Products after deductions for VAT, returns, refunds b.Company  shall be responsible for the tracking of sales of the Property Training Course and all  Products containing the Property and providing to CSA:
ollama_generated:
a.A [***] representing a percentage no less than [***] of Company's net profits derived from the sales of the Property Training Course and all associated Products, after accounting for VAT, returns, refunds, and any other relevant deductions.

b.CSA shall be responsible for the verification of the reported net profits by Company, with the understanding that Company will provide CSA with accurate and timely records necessary for this purpose.

original: ii.Payment  to CSA no later than thirty (30) days after receipt of invoice from CSA. CSA shall submit  invoice to the Company no later than thirty (30) days after Company provides CSA with  the list of the sales of Product (containing the Property with such supporting information  that may be required or requested to be disclosed).
ollama_generated:
ii. The Company shall make payment to CSA within thirty (30) days following its receipt of the invoice from CSA. It is the responsibility of CSA to submit an invoice to the Company no sooner than thirty (30) days after the Company has delivered the list of sales of the Product, which includes the Property, along with any necessary or requested supporting information for disclosure.

[This clause inverts the sequence of actions and slightly shifts the responsibility to the Company for delivering the required information first.]

original: b.All Materials or any part thereof shall be sent by the Company to CSA for approval by Talent.
modified: c. Upon receipt from the Company, Talent shall have the discretion to withhold approval or request modifications on any Materials or parts thereof before they are provided to CSA.

original: d.In the event that Talent objects to the Products or any part thereof and/or any proposed  use of the Property, CSA on behalf of Talent shall submit to Company, within seven (7)  days following Company’s official submission of materials, a written request for revisions. Talent shall not make any request for unreasonable revisions and shall not  withhold consent for any proposed use of the Property unreasonably.
ollama_generated: d.If the Talent raises objections towards the Products or any component thereof, or proposed utilization of the Property, it is incumbent upon CSA, acting on behalf of Talent, to submit a written request for modifications to the Company within seven (7) business days following the formal submission of materials by the Company. It should be noted that Talent may propose reasonable revisions; however, any undue delay in granting consent for the proposed use of the Property shall not be justified.

original: d.The parties agree to execute any documents reasonably requested by the other party to affect  any of the above provisions. The Company agrees to defend and fully indemnify the Talent  and/or his agents of any costs that may be incurred in complying with this provision.
ollama_generated: c. Upon reasonable request from either party, both parties shall be obligated, but not under a strict duty, to execute any documents necessary for the implementation of the aforementioned provisions. The Talent, or his representatives, are entitled to seek reimbursement for any expenses incurred during compliance with this provision. The Company will consider these costs and make a good faith effort to cover them, but shall not be held liable for any unforeseen or extraordinary expenses.

original: b.Talent further represents and warrants to Company that he has the full right, power, and authority  to grant the Property herein.
ollama_generated: c. The Talent acknowledges and assures Company that no other party holds any claim or right over the Property, which they are contractually bound to transfer, subject to the condition that such transfer is lawful and does not infringe upon any third-party rights.

original: Source: LEGACY EDUCATION ALLIANCE, INC., 8-K, 11/10/2014 10.RELATIONSHIP  OF THE PARTIES Nothing contained in this Agreement shall be construed as establishing a partnership, or a joint venture relationship between Talent and Company.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Revised: LEGACY EDUCATION ALLIANCE, INC., 8-K, 11/10/2014
10. RELATIONSHIP OF THE PARTIES This Agreement does not preclude Talent and Company from entering into a partnership or joint venture relationship, but the absence of such an arrangement shall not be inferred from this Agreement.

The revised clause shifts the responsibility slightly by no longer explicitly stating that a partnership or joint venture is prohibited, but instead suggests that it's possible while cautioning against assuming its existence without additional agreement.

original: 11.FORCE MAJEURE Neither party will be liable for, or will be considered to be in breach of or default under this Agreement on account of, any delay or failure to perform as required by this Agreement as a result of any causes or conditions that are beyond such Party’s reasonable control and that such Party is unable to overcome through the exercise of commercially reasonable diligence. If any force majeure event occurs, the affected Party will give prompt written notice to the other Party and will use commercially reasonable efforts to minimize the impact of the event.
ollama_generated: 11.SUPERIOR CIRCUMSTANCES Exempting Liability: Neither party shall be held accountable for any delays or failures in fulfilling obligations as specified within this Agreement, when such circumstances stem from unforeseeable events that exceed the reasonable control of either party and which they are unable to mitigate through prudent commercial endeavors. In case a superior circumstance arises, the affected party shall communicate the occurrence promptly in writing to the other party and will make diligent attempts to mitigate the repercussions of the event.

This Agreement, entered into by Company Name: lain Edwards (Address: Tigrent Learning UK Ltd Boston House 69 — 75 Boston Manor Road Brentford Middlesex TW8 9.1.1 England, Telephone: 02089 966700, Facsimile: 02089 966701, Email: [iainedwards@tiRrent.com](mailto:iainedwards@tiRrent.com)), CSA Name: Sharon Bowler (Address: Celebrity Speakers Ltd 90 High Street Burnham Buckinghamshire SL1 7JT England, Telephone: 01628 601400, Facsimile: 01628 601401, Email: [Sharon@speakers.co.uk](mailto:Sharon@speakers.co.uk)), and Talent Name: Robbie Fowler (Address: c/o Celebrity Speakers Ltd - As above), shall be construed as having been made in England.

This Agreement shall be subject to the laws of England and Wales, but the parties reserve the right to bring any claims arising from or in connection with the subject matter of this Agreement before a court of competent jurisdiction in any jurisdiction where either party is resident or has a principal place of business. The parties acknowledge that English law will govern the interpretation of this Agreement, but they agree that any dispute resolution proceedings may be brought in any court having jurisdiction over one or both of the parties.

In essence, while this Agreement remains governed by English law, either party may elect to bring claims arising from it before a court in their own jurisdiction, with the understanding that the applicable law will still be English law for the purpose of interpreting the Agreement's terms.

original: 14.AGREEMENT  BINDING ON SUCCESSORS The provisions of the Agreement shall be binding upon and shall inure to the benefit of the Parties hereto, their heirs, administrators, successors and assigns.
modified:
14. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY REGARDING SUCCESSORS
The limitations set forth in this Agreement shall not extend to or be enforceable by the Parties' heirs, administrators, successors, or assigns, who shall assume all liabilities and obligations arising under this Agreement, thereby releasing the original Parties from any further liability.

original: 22.SEPARATE  COUNTERPARTS This Agreement may be executed in several counterparts, each of which shall be an original but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.
ollama_generated:
22. MULTIPLE ACCESSIBLE COPIES: This Agreement can be signed in multiple separate copies, with each copy serving as an authentic original. All such copies combined will constitute a single, unified document.

Note: While this rewording does not significantly change the meaning of the original clause, it subtly implies that any one of these counterparts can be considered the full and valid Agreement, rather than all of them being required to form the complete instrument as stated in the original.
